access-lists.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this access list?
access-lists.delete-has-hosts: This Access List is associated with {count} Proxy Hosts. They will become publicly available upon deletion.
access-lists.help-content:
Access Lists provide a blacklist or whitelist of specific client IP addresses along with authentication for the Proxy Hosts via Basic HTTP Authentication.
You can configure multiple client rules, usernames and passwords for a single Access List and then apply that to a Proxy Host.
This is most useful for forwarded web services that do not have authentication mechanisms built in or that you want to protect from access by unknown clients.
access-lists.pass-auth: Don't pass credentials to backend of host
access-lists.satisfy-any: Allow access if at least one authorization method succeeded
access-lists.title: Access Lists

all-hosts.advanced-config-header-info: Please note, adding a location '/' will overwrite the proxy configuration
all-hosts.advanced-config-var-headline: These proxy details are available as nginx variables:
all-hosts.advanced-warning: Enter your custom Nginx configuration here at your own risk!
all-hosts.empty-subtitle: {manage, select, true{Why don't you create one?} other{And you don't have permission to create one.}}
all-hosts.no-tls: This host will not use HTTPS

audit-log.empty-subtitle: As soon as you or another user changes something, history of those events will show up here.
audit-log.title: Audit Log

certificates.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this TLS Certificate? Any hosts using it will need to be updated later.
certificates.help-content:
TLS certificates (previously known as SSL Certificates) are a form of encryption key which allows your site to be encrypted for the end user.
NPMplus uses by default a service called Let's Encrypt to issue TLS certificates for free.
If you have any sort of personal information, passwords, or sensitive data behind NPM, it's probably a good idea to use a certificate.
NPMplus also supports DNS authentication for if you're not running your site facing the internet, or if you just want a wildcard certificate.
certificates.reachability-404: There is a server found at this domain but it does not seem to be NPMplus. Please make sure your domain points to the IP where your NPMplus instance is running.
certificates.reachability-failed-to-check: Failed to check the reachability due to a communication error with site24x7.com.
certificates.reachability-failed-to-reach-api: Communication with the API failed, is NPMplus running correctly?
certificates.reachability-info: Test whether the domains are reachable from the public internet using Site24x7. This is not necessary when using the DNS Challenge.
certificates.reachability-not-resolved: There is no server available at this domain. Please make sure your domain exists and points to the IP where your NPMplus instance is running and if necessary port 80 is forwarded in your router.
certificates.reachability-ok: Your server is reachable and creating certificates should be possible.
certificates.reachability-other: There is a server found at this domain but it returned an unexpected status code {code}. Is it the NPMplus server? Please make sure your domain points to the IP where your NPMplus instance is running.
certificates.reachability-wrong-data: There is a server found at this domain but it returned an unexpected data. Is it the NPMplus server? Please make sure your domain points to the IP where your NPMplus instance is running.
certificates.title: TLS Certificates

dead-hosts.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this Dead Host?
dead-hosts.help-content:
A Dead Host is simply a host setup that shows a 404 page.
This can be useful when your domain is listed in search engines and you want to provide a nicer error page or specifically to tell the search indexers that the domain pages no longer exist.
Another benefit of having this host is to track the logs for hits to it and view the referrers.
dead-hosts.title: Dead Hosts

proxy-hosts.custom-forward-host-help:
Add a path for sub-folder forwarding.
Example: 203.0.113.25/path/
proxy-hosts.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the Proxy host for: {domains}?
proxy-hosts.help-content:
A Proxy Host is the incoming endpoint for a web service that you want to forward.
It provides optional TLS termination for your service that might not have TLS support built in.
Proxy Hosts are the most common use for the NPMplus.
proxy-hosts.title: Proxy Hosts

redirection-hosts.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the Redirection host for: {domains}?
redirection-hosts.help-content:
A Redirection Host will redirect requests from the incoming domain and push the viewer to another domain.
The most common reason to use this type of host is when your website changes domains but you still have search engine or referrer links pointing to the old domain.
redirection-hosts.title: Redirection Hosts

settings.default-site-444: Drop connection - only allows certbot dns-challenge
settings.default-site-description: What to show when Nginx is hit with an unknown Host
settings.title: Settings

streams.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this Stream?
streams.forward-type-error: At least one type of protocol must be enabled
streams.help-content:
A relatively new feature for Nginx, a Stream will serve to forward TCP/UDP traffic directly to another computer on the network.
If you're running game servers, FTP or SSH servers this can come in handy.
streams.title: Streams

tls.certbot-agree: I Agree to the Let's Encrypt Terms of Service / ToS of custom set CA
tls.certbot-warning: This section requires some knowledge about Certbot and its DNS plugins. Please consult the respective plugins documentation.

tls.delete-tls: The TLS certificates attached will NOT be removed, they will need to be removed manually.
tls.hosts-warning: These domains must be already configured to point to this installation
tls.no-wildcard-without-dns: Cannot request Certificate for wildcard domains when not using DNS challenge
tls.passphrase-protection-support-info: Key files protected with a passphrase are not supported. OCSP Stapling is not supported on custom certificates.
tls.processing-info: Processing... This might take a few minutes.
tls.propagation-seconds-info: Leave empty to use the plugins default value. Number of seconds to wait for DNS propagation.
